sys_metadata_link.payload:
true 834f07841be200105c01dd3cdc4bcbb8 not requested 2020-01-20 09:15:55 6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441 Objective


In the following induction task you build a custom catalog item and service catalog for a fictitious company called Land-Mark Caring, a large Hospital firm based in the Midwest. Its Hospital Services division is currently in the process of streamlining their medication refill process.
Land-Mark Caring is struggling with managing the current stock of medication and refilling this medication. There are three teams involved in this workflow:
Prescription Procurement—is a team made up of nurses that control the prescriptions throughout the hospital and the order of prescriptions.
Prescription Approval—is the approval group associated to the chosen prescription.
Prescription Restock—is a team made up of nurse’s assistants that refill the prescriptions when an
order is received.

This fragmented approach meant that previous prescriptions refills required multiple emails. Resolving this request fulfillment process can help the hospital replace inefficient email-based service requests. 

The induction task sections below break down pieces of functionality that are used to accomplish requirements given by Land-Mark Caring.
Requirements
1. A task should be generated for the group: Prescription Procurement.
a. This task should confirm with a variable if the prescription is Out of Stock or not.
i. The customer should not see the variable while ordering, and it should be mandatory on the task.

  1. If the prescription is Out of Stock medication must be approved by group associated to the prescription. 
  2. If the prescription is out of stock: A task should be generated for the group: Prescription Restock. 

a. This task should confirm the prescription was restocked.
i. The customer should not see the question while ordering, and the variable should
become mandatory when the state becomes Closed Complete. 4. Inform the customer where the request stands with custom stages. 

 

The update set enclosed in this KB should be imported in your instance. 

Estimated Time To complete
2 hours

 

Knowledge Required
Service Catalog core configuration. 
Review wiki for workflows.

 

Test Case


I. Review of Catalog Item
This task session explains how to drive interaction at the task level using variables, UI polices, workflows activities and non- Global variables.
In this first task, you review the catalog item Prescription Requests.

This is a custom catalog item specific to Land-Mark Caring, the company wants customized 

1. Navigate to Catalog Definitions > Maintain Items.

2. Select Catalog Item Prescription Requests. 

3. Select Try It. 

 

4. Review the current state of the catalog item Prescription Requests:

Per requirement #1, Prescription Out of Stock should be removed from catalog item and only be present on tasks generated for the group Prescription Procurement. Sections below guide this process.

Per requirement #2, the group associated to the prescription chosen must approve the medication. Each prescription has and associated approval group that can be updated without admin participation.

Per requirement #2 Prescription was refilled should be removed from catalog item and only be present on tasks generated for the group Prescription Restock. Sections below guide this process. 

 

  
 
 II. Configuring UI Polices to Remove Variable and Make Mandatory 

 

Land-Mark Caring requested that the variable Prescription Out of Stock not be present on the catalog item Prescription Requests. This variable should only be present on the first catalog task. In the section below you remove the variable Prescription Out of Stock from the catalog item form and present the variable on the first task and make it Mandatory via UI Policy. 

1. Navigate to Catalog Definitions > Maintain Items > Prescription Requests. 

2. Navigate to related list Catalog UI Policies and select New. 


 

 

3. Catalog UI Policy form opens. Name the Catalog UI Policy Remove Variables from Catalog item right click the header and select Save. 

4. The form reloads with a related list. On the related list Catalog UI Policy Actions, select New. 

 

5. A Catalog UI policy Action form opens. Select the Variable name fill_Prescription and set visible to False. Click Submit.

Note: You just created a catalog UI policy that only applies on the catalog item view. 

 

 

 

6. Navigate back to Service Catalog > Maintain Items > Prescription Requests. Navigate to related list Catalog UI Policies. Select New. 

 

7. A Catalog UI Policies form opens. Enter the description for the Catalog UI Policy Present variables on task form right click the header and select Save. 

8. The form reloads with a related list. On the related list Catalog UI Policy Actions, select New. 

9. Select the Variable name fill_Prescription and set Mandatory to True. Click Submit. 

10. Navigate to the Catalog UI Policy Present variables on task form. In the Related Links section select Advanced view. 

 

11. Select the section When to Apply. 

12. These check boxes represent when the Catalog UI policy runs. Set Applies on Catalog Item view to False. Set Applies on Catalog tasks to True. Click Submit.

Note: You just configured a UI policy to run only on the task form. This UI policy is now configured to make a variable mandatory on the task form. 

 

 

III. Configure Workflow to Present Variables on Task 

 

The UI Polices configured above remove a variable from a catalog form and present it on a task form. Now configure the variable to show on a certain task. Below you configure a catalog task activity that shows the variable Prescription Out of Stock. 

 

1. Navigate to Service Catalog > Maintain Items > Prescription Requests. 

2. Populate the workflow field with Prescription Requests Workflow and Update the record.

 

3. Navigate back to the catalog item. Service Catalog > Maintain Items > Prescription Requests. In the workflow field, click the Show Workflow icon. 

4. The workflow appears in a new tab. Navigate to the new tab. Check the workflow out, by selecting the Workflow Actions button and Checkout. 

5. After checking out the workflow, select Core > Core Activities > Tasks > Catalog Task drag the activity to the middle of the screen. 

 

6. Enter the information below into the Catalog task workflow activity.

Name: Prescription Request

Fulfillment Group: Prescription Procurement

Short description: Prescription Request

Priority: 2 - High

Instructions: If prescription refill is needed please action the variable Prescription Out of Stock accordingly.

 

7. After filling in the above information, navigate to the bottom of the catalog task workflow activity. All fields presented in Variables on Task Form should be moved from Available to Selected. When complete save the activity by pressing Submit.

Note: All variables moved to the selected side of the variables on task form are present on this task. 

 

 

8. You are redirected to the workflow. Connect the Catalog Task workflow activity to the Begin activity. 

 

IV. Configure Conditional If Statement 

Microsoft Word - APPROVED_Catalog_301_Lab_Guide.docx

A conditional if statement will be configured below to recognize the action of the fulfiller.

 

  1. In the section below use an If activity to check to see what was returned from the variable Prescription Out of Stock. If Yes is returned, create another task and assign it to Prescription Restock. 

  2. Select Core > Core Activities > Conditions > If drag the activity to the middle of the screen. 

 

3. Enter the below information into the If activity.
Name: Prescription Out of Stock
Condition: (to see the variable field in the conditional field selector select Show Related Fields) 

4. Submit the activity. 

5. Connect the Catalog Task workflow activity to the If workflow activity. 

 

V. Configure Prescription Approval 

Microsoft Word - APPROVED_Catalog_301_Lab_Guide.docx

If the prescription is Out of Stock the group associated to the prescription must approve the medication. In the section below you will configure this approval.

 

1. Select Core > Core Activities > Approval > Approval – Group drag the activity to the middle of the screen. 

 

 

2. On the Approval – Group Activity set Advance to true. 

3. Enter the below information into the approval activity. Name: Prescription Approval

Script: 

 

var answer = [];

answer.push(current.variables.prescription.u_owner_group); 

4. Submit the Approval task 
5. Connect the Yes If activity to the Approval – Group activity. 
 

 

6. Navigate to Core > Core Activities > Approval > Approval Action drag the activity to the middle of the screen. 
7. Enter the below information into the Approval Action.

Name: Prescription Approval

Action: Mark task approved 


8. Submit the record  

 

 

9. Connect the Approval – Group activity to the Approval Action. 

 

VI. Configure Catalog Task 

Microsoft Word - APPROVED_Catalog_301_Lab_Guide.docx

If the prescription is out of stock: A task should be generated for the group Prescription Restock. In the section below you will configure this task.

1. Configure another task. Select Core > Core Activities > Tasks > Catalog Task drag the activity to the middle of the screen. 

 

2. Enter the information below into the Catalog Task workflow activity.

Name: Refill Out of Stock Prescription

Fulfillment Group: Prescription Restock

Short description: Refill Out of Stock Prescription

Priority: 2 - High

Instructions: To confirm you have refilled out of stock prescription close Task and Action variable. 

 

3. Submit the activity. 

4. Connect the workflow as shown in the example. 

5. Select Workflow Actions > Publish. 



VII. Remove Variable from Catalog Item Form Using a UI Policy 

Microsoft Word - APPROVED_Catalog_301_Lab_Guide.docx

Land-Mark Caring has requested that the variable Prescription was refilled should only be present on the second task. The variable Prescription was refilled will be removed from that catalog item form via a previously configured UI Policy.

1. Navigate to Catalog Definitions > Maintain Items > Prescription Requests. 

2. Navigate to the related list Catalog UI Policies and select Remove Variables from Catalog item. 

 

  

3. Navigate to the related list Catalog UI Policy Actions and select New. 

4. Select the Variable name pres_was_filled and set Visible to False. Submit the record. 

 

VIII. Configure Second Workflow Task to Present Variable

 

Land-Mark Caring requested that variable Prescription was refilled is only present on the second task.

In the section below, task two is manipulated so the variable Prescription was refilled is present.

1. Navigate to Service Catalog > Maintain Items > Prescription Requests. In the workflow field, click the Show Workflow icon. 

 

2. The workflow appears in a new tab. Navigate to the new tab. Check the workflow out, by selecting the Workflow Actions button and Checkout. 

3. Navigate to catalog task Refill Out of Stock Prescription. 

4. Navigate to field Variables on Task Form. Move the fields in the example from Available to Selected. Update the record. 

5. Navigate to Workflow Actions and select Publish. 

 

IX. Configure Custom Client Script to Confirm Action on Variable 

 

The requirements for Land-Mark Caring request that the variable Prescription was refilled become mandatory when the state becomes Closed Complete. In the section below you accomplish this requirement by implementing a client script on the catalog task table. 

 

1. Create catalog client script: Navigate to Client Scripts. 

2. Click New to create Client Script 

3. Create Client script with below information:

Name: Prescription Requests confirm

Table: Catalog Task [sc_task]

UI Type: Desktop

Type: onChange

Field name: State

Script: 

 

XII. Creating Custom Stages 

 

In the section below you will create custom stages.

 

1. Navigate to Service Catalog > Maintain Items > Prescription Requests. In the workflow field, click the Show Workflow icon. 

 

 

2. The workflow appears in a new tab. Navigate to the new tab. Check the workflow out, by selecting the Workflow Actions button and Checkout. 

3. Navigate back to the Workflow Actions button and select Edit Stages. 

4. Create a new Stage by selecting New. 

5. Fill in the following information 

Name: Prescription Request

Value: pre_request 

6. Create the stage by pressing Submit. 

7. Create another stage by selecting New. 

Fill in the following information

Name: Prescription Approval

Value: pres_appro 

8. Create the stage by pressing Submit. 

9. Create another Stage by selecting New. 

10. Fill in the following information

Name: Prescription Refill

Value: pre_refill 

11. Create the stage by pressing Submit. 

12. Close the Workflow Stage menu.

XII. Add Custom Stages to Workflow Activities 

In the section below add the custom stages to the workflow activities. 

1. Select task Prescription Request Task. 

 

 

 2. Add Prescription Request to the Stage Field. 

3. Select Update.

4. Select the approval activity Prescription Approval.

5. Add Prescription Approval to Stage field.

6. Select Update.

7. Select task called Refill Out of Stock Prescription. 

8. Add Prescription Refill to Stage field. 

9. Select Update.

10. Select Workflow Actions > Publish. 
 

XII. Catalog Item Prescription Requests

Microsoft Word - APPROVED_Catalog_301_Lab_Guide.docx

In the section below, catalog item Prescription Requests is ordered. While ordering this item, review all customizations applied.

1. Navigate to Catalog Definitions > Maintain Items. 

2. Select Catalog Item Prescription Requests.

3. Select Try It.

4. The Item will appear. 


 

5. Submit the request by selecting Order Now. 

6. Review custom stages on the Order Status Screen. 

7. Navigate to the created Requested item and into the Task created. The variable Prescription Out of Stock is not present on the Task form and Mandatory. 
 

 8. Set the variable Prescription Out of Stock to Yes 

 9.  Set State to Closed Complete and Update the record. 

 

10. This should have created an approval task.

11. Navigate to the approval task by returning to the Request item. 

12. Approve the approval. 

13. Navigate to second task by returning to the Request Item.

14. The second task is now attached and open. Select the Open task Refill Out of Stock Prescription. 

15. Set the State field to Close Complete Variable Prescription was refilled is now mandatory.

16. Action the Variable Prescription was refilled. Complete the task by selecting Update. 

 

Trainee  Instructions
Trainee should propose the technical design and get approval from Coach before implementing the solution. After approval please implement it in the instance specified by the Coach using separate update set. Perform the unit testing before reporting task as completed to the Coach.
